tool_description: This API can be used to convert UK standard electrical units of measurement. Currently this is limited to the conversion of Power (in Watts) to and from Current (in Ampheres).
name: Electrical Units
title: Electrical Units

api_list.name: Convert single phase power (watts) to current (ampheres)
api_list.description:
This endpoint takes an input of the following:

- Power in watts - float - required
- Power factor - float - defaults to 0.95
- Voltage in volts - float - defaults to 230

The output is in ampheres.

For example an input of the following:
`?power=3000&voltage=240 `

Would result in:
`{"current":13.16}`

api_list.name: Convert three phase power (watts) to current (ampheres)
api_list.description:
This endpoint takes an input of the following:

- Power in watts - float - required
- Power factor - float - defaults to 0.95
- Voltage in volts - float - defaults to 400

The output is in ampheres.

api_list.name: Convert single phase current (ampheres) to power (watts)
api_list.description:
This endpoint takes an input of the following:

- Current in ampheres - float - required
- Power factor - float - defaults to 0.95
- Voltage in volts - float - defaults to 230

The output is in watts.

api_list.name: Convert three phase current (ampheres) to power (watts)
api_list.description:
This endpoint takes an input of the following:

- Current in ampheres - float - required
- Power factor - float - defaults to 0.95
- Voltage in volts - float - defaults to 230

The output is in watts.
